subject: Science
title: Phytoplankton: The Invisible Forest
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Phytoplankton: The Invisible Forest.

hook.text: The most important organisms on Earth are invisible to the naked eye.

buildup.text: Phytoplankton are microscopic plants floating in the sunlit ocean layer.

discovery.text: They produce over 50% of Earth's oxygen â€” more than all the forests combined.

twist.text: They also absorb billions of tons of COâ‚‚, acting as a massive carbon sink.

climax.text: As oceans warm, phytoplankton populations are declining in many regions.

punchline.text: Half the oxygen you breathe comes from organisms you can't even see.

quiz.question: How much of Earth's oxygen do phytoplankton produce?
